borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal"><b><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-language:
EN-GB">Contaminated Land</span></b></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">The
     remediation scheme detailed in the </span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">remediation
     strategy document reference 2344-A2S-XX-XX-RP-Y-0002-02 by A -squared
     Studio </span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">must be carried out in accordance with its terms prior
     to commencement of the development, other than that required to carry out
     remediation, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning
     Authority. The Local Planning Authority must be given two weeks written
     notification of commencement of the remediation scheme works.</span></p>

<p class="MsoListParagraph"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">Following
completion of the measures identified in the remediation scheme, a verification
report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must
be produced and is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning
Authority. The report shall include results of sampling and monitoring carried
out to demonstrate that the site remediation criteria have been met.</span></p><p class="MsoListParagraph"><span style="color: windowtext; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">If contamination is found at any time when carrying out
     the approved development that was not previously identified it must be
     reported in writing immediately to the Local Planning Authority. An
     investigation and risk assessment must be undertaken in accordance with
     the following requirements:</span></p>

<ol style="margin-top:0cm" start="1" type="a">
 <li class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:18.0pt;mso-add-space:auto;mso-list:
     l0 level1 lfo3"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:
     &quot;Times New Roman&quot;">an investigation and risk assessment, in addition to
     any assessment provided with the planning application, shall be completed
     in accordance with a scheme to assess the nature and extent of any
     contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site. The
     contents of the scheme are subject to the approval in writing of the Local
     Planning Authority. <o:p></o:p></span></li>
</ol>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:54.0pt;mso-add-space:auto"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">The investigation and risk assessment
must be undertaken by competent persons and a written report of the findings
must be produced. The written report is subject to the approval in writing of
the Local Planning Authority.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:54.0pt;mso-add-space:auto"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">The report of the findings must include:
<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:54.0pt;mso-add-space:auto"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">(i) a survey of the extent, scale and
nature of contamination;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:54.0pt;mso-add-space:auto"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">(ii) an assessment of the potential
risks to human health; property (existing or proposed) including buildings,
crops, livestock, pets, woodland and service lines and pipes; adjoining land;
groundwaters and surface waters; ecological systems; archaeological sites and
ancient monuments; and <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:54.0pt;mso-add-space:auto"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">(iii) an appraisal of remedial options,
and proposal of the preferred option(s). This must be conducted in accordance
with DEFRA and the Environment Agency’s ‘Model Procedures for the Management of
Land Contamination, CLR 11.</span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:54.0pt;mso-add-space:auto"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">Where remediation is necessary the
following will be required:</span></p>

<ol style="margin-top:0cm" start="2" type="a">
 <li class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:18.0pt;mso-add-space:auto;mso-list:
     l0 level1 lfo3"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:
     &quot;Times New Roman&quot;">a detailed remediation scheme, to bring the site to a
     condition suitable for the intended use by removing unacceptable risks to
     human health, buildings and other property and the natural and historical
     environment, shall be prepared and submitted to the Local Planning
     Authority for approval in writing. The scheme must include all works to be
     undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria,
     timetable of works and site management procedures. The scheme must ensure
     that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the
     Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the
     land after remediation.</span></li></ol>

<ol style="margin-top:0cm" start="3" type="a">
 <li class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:18.0pt;mso-add-space:auto;mso-list:
     l0 level1 lfo3"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:
     &quot;Times New Roman&quot;">Following completion of the measures identified in the
     approved remediation scheme a verification report must be prepared, which
     is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</span></li></ol>

<p>Hard and Soft Landscaping
</p><p>(a) The hard and soft landscaping shown on hereby
approved drawing/ document:&nbsp;<span style="font-family: Tahoma, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Proposed Site Plan (ref. PL-06-100 Rev A)';&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Tahoma, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Proposed Landscape Plan (ref. PL-70-100 Rev A); and&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Tahoma, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Design and Access Statement (Turner Works) dated December 2022 – Amended
     Site Levels'&nbsp;</span>shall
be carried out prior to the first occupation of the development and thereafter permanently retained for the duration of the development.</p><p>(b) Any plants which within a period of 2 years from the grant of temporary planning permission which die, are removed or
become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of similar size and species
unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Car Parking
</p><p>Prior to first occupation the hereby approved car parking spaces and Electrical Vehicle charging spaces and equipment shall be marked
out, installed and retained thereafter for the duration of the temporary planning permission in accordance with the hereby approved plans:</p><ul style="margin-top:0cm" type="disc">
 <li class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-left:0cm;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:&quot;Tahoma&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:
     &quot;Times New Roman&quot;">Transport Statement, prepared by WSP, dated 22
     September 2022</span></li><li class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-left:0cm;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:&quot;Tahoma&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:
     &quot;Times New Roman&quot;">Transport Cover Note, dated 5 December 2022,
prepared by WSP</span></li><li class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-left:0cm;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1"><font face="Tahoma, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 13.3333px;">Proposed Site Plan (ref. PL-06-100 Rev A)&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 10pt;">&nbsp;</span></font></li><li class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-left:0cm;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1">Proposed Landscape Plan (ref. PL-70-100 A)<font face="Tahoma, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 13.3333px;">.</span></font></li></ul>

<p>Ecology </p><p>Prior to above ground works any development must be carried out with all necessary mitigation measures outlined in the
hereby approved document '<span style="font-family: Tahoma, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Biodiversity Statement' (Surface) dated
     October 2022 and '</span><span style="font-family: Tahoma, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Ecology Technical Advice Note' dated 2 December 2022 (Surface)</span>&nbsp;and maintained for the duration of the lifetime of the
development.&nbsp;</p>
The development hereby permitted shall be commenced before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

<p>Cycle Parking </p><p>Prior to first occupation the hereby approved cycle parking spaces and welfare facilities shall installed and retained for the duration of the temporary planning permission in accordance with the hereby approved plans:</p><ul type="disc" style="margin-top: 0cm;"><li class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-left: 0cm;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Tahoma, sans-serif;">Transport Statement, prepared by WSP, dated 22 September 2022</span></li><li class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-left: 0cm;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Tahoma, sans-serif;">Transport Cover Note, dated 5 December 2022, prepared by WSP</span></li><li class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-left: 0cm;"><font face="Tahoma, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 13.3333px;">Proposed Site Plan (ref. PL-06-100 Rev A)&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 10pt;">&nbsp;</span></font></li><li class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-left: 0cm;">Proposed Landscape Plan (ref. PL-70-100 A)<font face="Tahoma, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 13.3333px;">.</span></font></li></ul>

<p>Temporary Use Duration</p><p>The uses hereby permitted shall be discontinued and the site restored to its former condition and all fixtures, fittings and equipment removed on or before 10 years from the grant of temporary planning permission.</p>

<p>Travel Plan </p><p>The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the submitted Travel Plan '<span style="font-family: Tahoma, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Travel Plan Technical Note, prepared by WSP, dated 23
     September 2022' for the duration of the development.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>

<p>Secured by Design </p><p>Prior to first occupation of the building(s) hereby permitted, a ‘Secure by Design’ accreditation shall be obtained for such building(s) or parts of the building(s) and shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p>

<p>Operating hours (including deliveries) </p><p>The non-office uses hereby permitted are to be permitted to operate, trade accept or make deliveries between the hours of 07:00 and 24:00 (midnight) on any day and at no other time.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Permitted Temporary Uses</p><p>Notwithstanding the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking, re-enacting or modifying that Order), the site shall be used for uses falling within Sui Generis (p) (q) and Class E (b) (c) (g) and for no other purpose of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order).</p>

<p class="MsoNormal">Materials</p><p class="MsoNormal">The external materials of the building and all hard and soft landscaping to be used in the construction of the development hereby permitted shall match those described in the approved document '<span style="font-family: Tahoma, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Design and Access Statement (Turner Works) dated December 2022 –
Amended Site Levels and be maintained for the duration of the temporary consent.&nbsp;</span><br></p>
description:
Erection of a two-storey building comprising
BRL project office, and restaurant space with barista/deli offer, associated
landscaping and parking for a temporary period within Plot DC4B, Stage 4.
